column15: B01. I am interested in my work
column16: B02. I am sufficiently challenged by my work
column17: B03. My work gives me a sense of personal accomplishment
column18: B04. I feel involved in the decisions that affect my work
column19: B05. I have a choice in deciding how I do my work
column20: B06. I have a clear understanding of [my organisation's] objectives
column21: B07. I understand how my work contributes to [my organisation's] objectives
column22: B08. My manager motivates me to be more effective in my job
column23: B09. My manager is considerate of my life outside work
column24: B10. My manager is open to my ideas
column25: B11. My manager helps me to understand how I contribute to [my organisation's] objectives
column26: B12. Overall, I have confidence in the decisions made by my manager
column27: B13. My manager recognises when I have done my job well
column28: B14. I receive regular feedback on my performance
column29: B15. The feedback I receive helps me to improve my performance
column30: B16. I think that my performance is evaluated fairly
column31: B17. Poor performance is dealt with effectively in my team
column32: B18. The people in my team can be relied upon to help when things get difficult in my job
column33: B19. The people in my team work together to find ways to improve the service we provide
column34: B20. The people in my team are encouraged to come up with new and better ways of doing things
column35: B21. I am able to access the right learning and development opportunities when I need to
column36: B22. Learning and development activities I have completed in the past 12 months have helped to improve my performance
column37: B23. There are opportunities for me to develop my career in [my organisation]
column38: B24. Learning and development activities I have completed while working for [my organisation] are helping me to develop my career
column39: B25. I am treated fairly at work
column40: B26. I am treated with respect by the people I work with
column41: B27. I feel valued for the work I do
column42: B28. I think that [my organisation] respects individual differences (e.g. cultures, working styles, backgrounds, ideas, etc)
column43: B29. I get the information I need to do my job well
column44: B30. I have clear work objectives
column45: B31. I have the skills I need to do my job effectively
column46: B32. I have the tools I need to do my job effectively
column47: B33. I have an acceptable workload
column48: B34. I achieve a good balance between my work life and my private life
column49: B35. I feel that my pay adequately reflects my performance
column50: B36. I am satisfied with the total benefits package
column51: B37. Compared to people doing a similar job in other organisations I feel my pay is reasonable
column52: B38. [Senior managers] in [my organisation] are sufficiently visible
column53: B39. I believe the actions of [senior managers] are consistent with [my organisation's] values
column54: B40. I believe that [the board has] a clear vision for the future of [my organisation]
column55: B41. Overall, I have confidence in the decisions made by [my organisation's senior managers]
column56: B42. I feel that change is managed well in [my organisation]
column57: B43. When changes are made in [my organisation] they are usually for the better
column58: B44. [My organisation] keeps me informed about matters that affect me
column59: B45. I have the opportunity to contribute my views before decisions are made that affect me
column60: B46. I think it is safe to challenge the way things are done in [my organisation]
column61: B47. I am proud when I tell others I am part of [my organisation]
column62: B48. I would recommend [my organisation] as a great place to work
column63: B49. I feel a strong personal attachment to [my organisation]
column64: B50. [My organisation] inspires me to do the best in my job
column65: B51. [My organisation] motivates me to help it achieve its objectives
column66: B52. I believe that [senior managers] in [my organisation] will take action on the results from this survey
column67: B53. Where I work, I think effective action has been taken on the results of the last survey
column68: B54. I am trusted to carry out my job effectively
column69: B55. I believe I would be supported if I try a new idea, even if it may not work
column70: B56. In [my organisation], people are encouraged to speak up when they identify a serious policy or delivery risk
column71: B57. I feel able to challenge inappropriate behaviour in the workplace
column72: B58. My organisation is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace
column73: B59. [Senior managers] in [my organisation] actively role model the behaviours set out in the Civil Service Leadership Statement
column74: B60. My manager actively role models the behaviours set out in the Civil Service Leadership Statement

column76: B62. I understand how my work contributes to helping us become 'A Brilliant Civil Service'
